security_audit.summary: Official Anthropic skill containing only documentation and brand guidelines. No executable code, no external dependencies, no security vulnerabilities detected. Apache 2.0 licensed.

content.value_statement: Apply Anthropic's official brand identity, colors, and typography to any artifact needing consistent corporate visual styling.
actual_capabilities: Apply official Anthropic brand colors to artifacts
Apply branded typography (Poppins for headings, Lora for body text)
Smart font fallback to system fonts (Arial/Georgia)
Cycle accent colors (orange, blue, green) for visual elements
Smart color selection based on background contrast
Preserve text hierarchy and formatting during styling
limitations: Requires Poppins and Lora fonts pre-installed for optimal appearance (falls back to Arial/Georgia if unavailable)
Applies to artifacts that support styling (presentations, documents, graphics)
Color application uses RGB values requiring compatible output format
Font styling only applies to 24pt+ headings automatically

use_cases.title: Company Presentation Styling
use_cases.description: Apply brand colors and typography to presentation slides to ensure consistent Anthropic branding across all company communications

use_cases.title: Visual Design Consistency
use_cases.description: Maintain visual identity across diverse artifact types (reports, graphics, documents) using standardized brand elements
use_cases.target_user: Design teams, marketing departments, brand managers

use_cases.title: Post-Processing Brand Application
use_cases.description: Apply brand styling as a final step to any generated artifact without modifying core content
use_cases.target_user: Content creators, document generators, design workflows

prompt_templates.title: Basic Brand Application
prompt_templates.prompt: Apply Anthropic's brand guidelines to this [artifact type], using official colors and typography
prompt_templates.scenario: When you need to style any content with Anthropic branding

prompt_templates.title: Specific Color Application
prompt_templates.prompt: Use Anthropic's brand colors for [specific elements] in this artifact: primary dark (#141413), accent orange (#d97757), and light backgrounds (#faf9f5)
prompt_templates.scenario: When you need precise control over which colors apply to which elements

prompt_templates.title: Typography Styling
prompt_templates.prompt: Apply Anthropic's typography: Poppins font for headings (24pt+) and Lora font for body text
prompt_templates.scenario: When focusing on text styling without other design changes

output_examples.input: A presentation slide with default styling
output_examples.output: Slide with Anthropic brand colors applied (dark text on light backgrounds, orange accents), Poppins headings, Lora body text
Graphic with Anthropic accent colors applied to shapes (cycling orange, blue, green), maintaining visual hierarchy
Document with brand typography applied, using official Anthropic color palette for text and visual elements

best_practices: Pre-install Poppins and Lora fonts in your environment for best visual results
Apply brand guidelines as a final styling step to preserve content modifications
Use accent colors (orange, blue, green) strategically for visual hierarchy and emphasis
Maintain sufficient contrast between text and background for readability
Apply consistent typography hierarchy: large Poppins headings, Lora body text
Test styling across different output formats to ensure color fidelity
anti_patterns: Applying brand colors without considering contrast and readability
Overusing accent colors in ways that distract from content
Assuming custom fonts are available without providing fallbacks
Applying typography changes to code or technical content that requires monospace fonts

faq.question: What if Poppins and Lora fonts aren't available on my system?
faq.answer: The skill automatically falls back to Arial for headings and Georgia for body text, maintaining the intended visual hierarchy while using universally available fonts.

faq.question: Can I use only some of the brand guidelines?
faq.answer: Yes, you can selectively apply colors, typography, or both. The skill is designed for flexible implementation based on your needs.

faq.question: What are the exact RGB values for Anthropic brand colors?
faq.answer: Primary colors: Dark #141413, Light #faf9f5, Mid Gray #b0aea5, Light Gray #e8e6dc. Accents: Orange #d97757, Blue #6a9bcc, Green #788c5d.

faq.question: What types of artifacts can this skill style?
faq.answer: Any artifact supporting styling: presentations, documents, graphics, PDFs. Works best with formats that preserve typography and color information.

faq.question: Is this skill only for internal Anthropic use?
faq.answer: This skill applies Anthropic's official brand guidelines. Use it when creating artifacts intended to reflect Anthropic's visual identity.

dependencies: Poppins font (optional - recommended for best results)
Lora font (optional - recommended for best results)
Output format supporting RGB colors and typography styling
permissions: Ability to modify artifact styling and formatting
